messages.subject: Re: Science Buffs, question!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/14/99 10:18:40 AM Pacific Daylight Time, hooperck@alltel.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/14/99 10:18:40 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
hooperck@... writes:

<< Why is it that hot water freezes faster than cold water?
I think this is true, but why? >>

My dad used to say this. I don't know if it's true or not but something
about the the rapid drop in temperature starting out and continues to be
rapid until frozen... Cold water gradually gets colder but hot water in a
freezer drops very quickly.

If you try it let me know.

Charlotte

messages.subject: Re: Science Buffs, question!

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/14/99 7:43:50 PM PST, RRAINENJ@... writes:

<< <<
Why is it that hot water freezes faster than cold water?
I think this is true, but why?
Ann >>

I believe I have heard that water which has been boiled freezes
faster...trying to remember why that is? Lori in TX
>>


I don't know about freezing faster, but water that is warm freezes clear.
Cold water freezes more cloudy.

Mary

messages.subject: Re: Science Buffs, question!
messages.msgSnippet: ... Well, the theory is that being hotter to start with, the rate of heat loss is more rapid. But.  Think about it. After a certain point, that hot water would
messages.messageBody:
> From: "A. Yates" <hooperck@...>
>
> Why is it that hot water freezes faster than cold water?
> I think this is true, but why?

Well, the theory is that being hotter to start with, the rate of heat loss
is more rapid.

But. Think about it.

After a certain point, that hot water would become cold water, and from
there, the rate of heat loss would be the same. So.

Try it out for yourself, see if it's true.


Linda

--
Linda Wyatt
hilinda@...
http://www.lightlink.com/hilinda
Learning everywhere, all the time.
Algebra before breakfast
"A lie, you see, no matter how often or how vociferously repeated, may be
mistaken for the truth, but it does not become the truth." - Adam Crown

messages.subject: Science Buffs, question!
messages.msgSnippet: Why is it that hot water freezes faster than cold water? I think this is true, but why? Ann
messages.messageBody:
Why is it that hot water freezes faster than cold water?
I think this is true, but why?
Ann
